short_description: XGBoost is a driver function to build a gradient boost model
long_description: XGBoost function takes the entire data set as training input and builds a strong classifier from an ensemble of weak classifiers.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input data set.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input data set.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table in which the function stores the predictive model it generates.
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the output table in which the function stores the predictive model it generates.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the response table column that contains the responses (labels) of the data.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the response table column that contains the responses (labels) of the data.

argument_clauses.name: NumericInputs
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the numeric predictor variables (which must be numeric values).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the numeric predictor variables (which must be numeric values).

argument_clauses.name: CategoricalInputs
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the categorical predictor variables (which can be either numeric or VARCHAR values). Each categorical input column can have at most max_cat_values distinct categorical values. If max_cat_values exceeds 20, the function might run out of memory, because classification trees grow rapidly as max_cat_values increases.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the categorical predictor variables (which can be either numeric or VARCHAR values). Each categorical input column can have at most max_cat_values distinct categorical values. If max_cat_values exceeds 20, the function might run out of memory, because classification trees grow rapidly as max_cat_values increases.

argument_clauses.name: IdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the partitioning column of input table. This column is used as a row identifier to distribute data among different vworkers for parallel boosted trees.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the partitioning column of input table. This column is used as a row identifier to distribute data among different vworkers for parallel boosted trees.

argument_clauses.name: NumBoostedTrees
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of boosted trees to be trained. By default, the number of boosted trees equals the number of vworkers available for the functions.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of boosted trees to be trained. By default, the number of boosted trees equals the number of vworkers available for the functions.

argument_clauses.name: DropOutputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to drop output_table if it exists. The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to drop output_table if it exists. The default value is 'true'.

argument_clauses.name: IterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of iterations to boost the weak classifiers, which is also the number of weak classifiers in the ensemble (T). The number must an INTEGER in the range [1, 100000]. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of iterations to boost the weak classifiers, which is also the number of weak classifiers in the ensemble (T). The number must an INTEGER in the range [1, 100000]. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: MinNodeSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the minimum size of any particular node within each decision tree. The min_node_size must an INTEGER. The default value is 100.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the minimum size of any particular node within each decision tree. The min_node_size must an INTEGER. The default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: MaxDepth
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum depth of the tree. The max_depth must an INTEGER in the range [1, 100000]. The default value is 12.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum depth of the tree. The max_depth must an INTEGER in the range [1, 100000]. The default value is 12.

argument_clauses.name: Variance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a decision tree stopping criterion. If the variance within any nodedips below this value, the algorithm stops looking for splits in the branch. The default value is 0.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies a decision tree stopping criterion. If the variance within any nodedips below this value, the algorithm stops looking for splits in the branch. The default value is 0.

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the seed to use to create a random number. The seed must be a positive BIGINT value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the seed to use to create a random number. The seed must be a positive BIGINT value.
